content: Given the following mathematical function expressions, you need to calculate the indefinite integral of the function (excluding the constant C), then substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral, and finally provide me with the integer result of the expression by rounding down. (The answer should consist of only a single integer number representing the final result, with no additional words.)

" First, let's calculate the indefinite integral of the function.

∫x²/(1+x) dx = ∫x² dx / (1+x) + ∫x²/ (1+x) dx

The first part is easy to integrate:

∫x² dx = (1/3)x³ + C

Now for the second part:

∫x²/ (1+x) dx = (1/3)x³ + x²ln(1+x) + C

So the indefinite integral is:

∫x²/(1+x) dx = (1/3)x³ / (1+x) + (1/3)x³ + x²ln(1+x) + C

Now substitute x=4 into the result of the indefinite integral:

(1/3)(4³) / (1+4) + (1/3)(4³) + (4²)ln(1+4) = (1/3)(64) / (1+4) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5)

This gives us:

(1/3)(64) / (1+4) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5) = (1/3)(64) / (5) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5)

Now we can calculate the final result:

(1/3)(64) / (5) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5) ≈ 4.84

So the final result is 4."

" \"First, let's calculate the indefinite integral of the function.\\n\\n∫x²/(1+x) dx = ∫x² dx / (1+x) + ∫x²/ (1+x) dx\\n\\nThe first part is easy to integrate:\\n\\n∫x² dx = (1/3)x³ + C\\n\\nNow for the second part:\\n\\n∫x²/ (1+x) dx = (1/3)x³ + x²ln(1+x) + C\\n\\nSo the indefinite integral is:\\n\\n∫x²/(1+x) dx = (1/3)x³ / (1+x) + (1/3)x³ + x²ln(1+x) + C\\n\\nNow substitute x=4 into the result of the indefinite integral:\\n\\n(1/3)(4³) / (1+4) + (1/3)(4³) + (4²)ln(1+4) = (1/3)(64) / (1+4) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5)\\n\\nThis gives us:\\n\\n(1/3)(64) / (1+4) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5) = (1/3)(64) / (5) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5)\\n\\nNow we can calculate the final result:\\n\\n(1/3)(64) / (5) + (1/3)(64) + (16)ln(5) ≈ 4.84\\n\\nSo the final result is 4.\""
